subject: Programming
title: GPUs and Massively Parallel Computing
description: A 60-second lesson on GPUs and Massively Parallel Computing.

hook.text: A CPU has 8 powerful cores. A GPU has thousands of tiny ones. Different tools for different jobs.

buildup.text: GPUs were designed to render millions of pixels simultaneously for video games.

discovery.text: Researchers realized GPU parallelism could accelerate scientific simulations and AI training.

twist.text: NVIDIA pivoted from gaming to AI. Its GPUs became the engine behind every major AI breakthrough.

climax.text: ChatGPT, image generators, and self-driving cars all run on GPU clusters, not traditional CPUs.

punchline.text: Gaming hardware accidentally powered the AI revolution.

quiz.question: What were GPUs originally designed for?
